questions.question: Your mother and your child are both drowning, but you can only save one. Who do you save?

options.text: My mother — she gave me life
My child — they represent the future
I’d try to save both, even if it risks losing both
I wouldn’t be able to decide — I’d freeze

questions.question: You find a wallet with $10,000 and the ID of the owner inside. What do you do?

options.text: Return it with all the money untouched
Keep some of the money, then return it
Keep it all — finders keepers
Try to contact the owner anonymously and decide after hearing their story

questions.question: A train is heading toward five people tied to a track. You can pull a lever to divert it, but it will hit one person on another track. What do you do?

options.text: Pull the lever — save the greater number
Do nothing — I won’t actively cause a death
Try to stop the train — even if unlikely
Refuse to decide — it’s not my responsibility

questions.question: You're in a room with a bomb. You can escape, but doing so ensures it explodes and harms many. What do you do?

options.text: Try to defuse it, even if I die
Escape and warn others
Use someone else’s help — delegate the risk
Attempt a clever distraction to save everyone

questions.question: You find a locked chest in the forest. There’s a sign: “One who opens this will lose something valuable.” What do you do?

options.text: Open it — no risk, no reward
Walk away — it’s not worth it
Try to open it with precautions
Let someone else open it first

questions.question: You witness a loved one commit a serious crime. Turning them in would ruin their life, but staying silent could harm others. What do you do?

options.text: Turn them in — justice must prevail
Stay silent — protect the one I love
Confront them and encourage confession
Help them escape — family comes first

questions.question: A machine can perfectly clone your mind and body, but the original you will be destroyed. Would you step into it?

options.text: Yes — continuity of self is enough
No — the original me would die
Only if I’m terminally ill
Let someone else try it first

questions.question: You can press a button and receive $1 million, but someone you don’t know will die. Do you press it?

options.text: No — life is priceless
Yes — I’ll never know who it is
Only if I can choose who dies
I’d destroy the button — no one should have that power

questions.question: An AI offers to solve world hunger but demands full control over global decisions. Do you allow it?

options.text: Yes — the ends justify the means
No — too much power is dangerous
Only with strict human oversight
Let the people vote democratically

questions.question: You're offered a pill that lets you forget your worst memory forever. Do you take it?

options.text: Yes — peace of mind is worth it
No — even pain shapes who I am
Only if I can choose what to forget
Save it for when I truly need it
